summary: Apple Inc. designs, manufactures, and markets smartphones, personal computers, tablets, wearables, and accessories worldwide. The company offers iPhone, a line of smartphones; Mac, a line of personal computers; iPad, a line of multi-purpose tablets; and wearables, home, and accessories comprising Ai. Apple's App Store generated nearly $1.3 trillion in sales in 2024, and the company has a strong track record of innovation and profitability.

Alphabet Inc. offers various products and platforms in the United States, Europe, the Middle East, Africa, the Asia-Pacific, Canada, and Latin America. The Google Services segment provides products and services, including ad, Google Cloud, and Other Bets. Google's updated Gemini 2.5 Pro AI model is better at certain programming tasks, and the company has a strong track record of innovation and growth.

Microsoft Corporation develops and supports software, services, devices, and solutions worldwide. The Productivity and Business Processes segment offers office, exchange, SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, office 365 Security and Compliance, Microsoft viva, and Microsoft 365 copilot; and office consumer services. Microsoft has a strong track record of innovation and growth, and its Azure business has had a huge first quarter of 2025.

Meta Platforms, Inc. engages in the development of products that enable people to connect and share with friends and family through mobile devices, personal computers, virtual reality and mixed reality headsets, augmented reality, and wearables worldwide. The company operates through two segments, Family of Products and Reality Labs. Meta has a strong track record of innovation and growth, but its stock has been volatile in recent times.

Tesla, Inc. designs, develops, manufactures, leases, and sells electric vehicles, and energy generation and storage systems in the United States, China, and internationally. The company operates in two segments, Automotive; and Energy Generation and Storage. Tesla's stock has been volatile in recent times, and the company faces intense competition in the electric vehicle market.

NVIDIA Corporation, a computing infrastructure company, provides graphics and compute and networking solutions in the United States, Singapore, Taiwan, China, Hong Kong, and internationally. The Compute & Networking segment comprises Data Center computing platforms and end-to-end networking platform. NVIDIA has a strong track record of innovation and growth, but its stock has been volatile in recent times.

Amazon.com, Inc. engages in the retail sale of consumer products, advertising, and subscriptions service through online and physical stores in North America and internationally. The company operates through three segments: North America, International, and Amazon Web Services (AWS). Amazon has a strong track record of innovation and growth, but its stock has been volatile in recent times.

Netflix, Inc. provides entertainment services. The company offers television (TV) series, documentaries, feature films, and games across various genres and languages. Netflix has a strong track record of innovation and growth, but its stock has been volatile in recent times.
